It was not too crowded as well and if you love a bit if history, architecture and peace then this is must to add on your list to Delhi.

Name: keith h
Title: Beautiful Lodhi Garden.
Review: If you are looking for a respite from the hustle & bustle & pollution of New Delhi a visit to Lodhi Gardens is the perfect destination.  Whenever I am in Delhi I always pay at least one visit to the gardens & I generally make a day of it by firstly visiting nearby Safdarjung's Tomb prior to walking round to Lodhi Gardens. Afterwards I either take a tuk tuk or walk to the beautiful grounds of Sunder Nursery.    Lodhi Gardens are situated in a quiet , up market area , not really far from central Delhi. If you are feeling like a good walk you can walk all the way along Janpath from Connaught Circle to reach there. Otherwise , take the metro to Jor Bagh or Khan Market & it is a short walk from either. If you go to Jor Bagh you can visit Safdarjang's Tomb en route.   The gardens cover 90 acres & are extremely well kept & patrolled. Large expanses of grass are punctuated by mature trees ( some labelled ), numerous walkways & paths , flower beds & numerous seats.   Tombs & structures from the Sayyid & Lodhi dynasties are notable . Also the Athipula bridge which spans a lake near the garden entrance on Subramanian Bharti Marg. The bridge dates from the reign of Akbar & the lake features a high reaching fountain & many geese & ducks which have the use & safety of a large , fenced compound.   The gardens are very popular with Delhiites & you can see many families enjoying a visit with picnics , some with pet dogs. Also it seems to be a popular venue for couples to get videos made of themselves in their finery.    Ladies walk around with baskets of children's toys for sale , balanced on their heads & if you are fancying a hot drink there is usually a roving chai wallah to be found.   Near the Lodhi Rd entrance you will find some glasshouses & flower beds & a great cluster of flowers in terracotta pots.   Lovely place to visit - stroll about , sit on a seat , soak in the vibe.

Name: Johnny9750

Name: Cecile1611

Name: Nitin Kumar (N.K.)

Review: Such a peaceful place to get rid of daily stressful life. And it's also best of photography lovers 📸 Although i suggest to take electric bike 🚴 to make the trip convenient...

Name: Payal G
Title: The best comes free
Review: Generally the Lodhi Gardens stay off the beaten track for tourists visiting Delhi the first time. However, these gardens should be on the must visit list for anyone interested in history and architecture as they house several monuments from the myriad pre-Mughal Islamic dynasties that ruled Delhi. Some of the relatively restored monuments include the Aathpul, Bada Gumbad mosque, Shish Gumbad, tomb of Muhammad Shah Sayyid and the fort like tomb of Sikandar Lodi. These gardens have served as the location in many movies and picture shoots. However, due to their expanse they still offer a great place for unwinding (in the daylight). It's a five minute walk across the road from the splendid Safdarjung tomb and about 10 minutes walk from the Jor Bagh station on the yellow line. And the best thing - it's free of cost for one and all.

Name: HelenHenry1967
Title: A place of peace and quiet amongst the chaos of Dehli
Review: This was a lovely place to visit. There are lots of monuments and bits to see amongst the well kept gardens. It was so nice to find a place of peace and quiet and it seemed to be well used by locals as well as foreign visitors.

Name: macedonboy
Title: Excellent gardens and nice monuments to see
Review: These gardens are best known for the ensemble of monuments constructed by Sayyid and Lodhi dynasty that ruled from the Delhi Sultanate from the 15th to the 16th century. The monuments include the tombs of Muhammad Shah Sayyid, Sikandar Lodi and Shish Gumbad, as well as the BADa Gumbad Mosque. While people do seem to come here to get their pictures taken at the aforementioned monuments, the gardens are well kept and tranquil. With many plants and tree lined pathways, it's a perfect spot for resting after a long day of sightseeing in the city.

Name: Gary U
Title: Must see in New Delhi
Review: Very romantic and relaxing trip to this garden. It is spacious, does not feel congested, well kept and has a few monuments that are worth visiting. You won’t regret going to this garden for a peaceful day. Unsure how this will be in the summer months, likely very dry and hot.

Name: Nikki S

Name: Abhishek J

Review: It's a green patch in new Delhi with a fort maintained by ASO in the heart. The park has open gym, meticulously labelled plants a cafeteria and lots of open space. One can have a nice time with family here.it caters to relaxation of every age group.

Name: Sunil
Title: Lodhi great garden
Review: The Lodhi garden is one of a kind place.the place has its history and local guide can explain on the place

Name: Kevin S

The gardens are pleasant and peaceful and make for a good quiet hour strolling around enjoying the different buildings.

Name: Harsh Bansal

Name: Chloe Augustin

Name: cfound59

Name: CleopatraLuxor

The park is free to enter, there were toilets at the main gate, would recommend you take food and water as there is nothing inside to buy these things.

Name: Vipul
Title: Best park in new delhi for picknic

Name: Madalyn H
Title: Delightful gardens

Name: Tiina

Name: scud56

Name: TheCreatist

Name: Ayra-Ibn-Batuta
Title: A green oasis steeped in history

Weekend evenings can be busy. It is just a stone's throw away from modern cafes in Khan Market and galleries/ culture hubs in India Habitat Centre (IHC) and India International Centre (IIC)

Name: Mainul Islam sk
Title: Lodhi garden : Feel the nature..
Review: Nice place. People used to come here for jogging. You can find some tourist over there. Muhammad Shah Sayyid's tomb and bara gumbad mosque are added places for attraction of this Garden. Its open for all without any entry fees. Enjoy the beauty of nature...

Name: Dan L
Title: Great Historic Walking Area
Review: As most attractions were closed on Monday, 7/10/19, our guide suggested a visit to these gardens. It is one of the historic gardens in Delhi and location of the tombs of rulers from the Sayyid and Lodhi dynasties. Covering an area of about 40ha. there is abundant greenery and impressive trees. The paths meander through delightful shaded areas and we were accompanied by some of the many squirrels that are resident; they seem to be everywhere that we lookd. We unfortunately missed seeing some of the attractions in the park, a guided tour would have been helpful.

Name: Shawn M
Title: A beautiful park near the heart of Delhi.
Review: I am a producer for television and have shot beauty shots in this park many times.  They ruins that span history are always a great backdrop for a picnic as well!  A must see if you have the time.

Name: meetpetef
Title: Great to get out of the business of Delhi
Review: Its perfect to take a walk and get out of the congested areas of Delhi.  Lots of history behind the Lodi leaders and their tombs.  Watch out of territorial stray dogs!

Name: jss
Title: Smog!
Review: Visited right after Halloween and extremely bad air. Smog gave my pictures a spooky feel. Local youth and cart vendors were very nice.

Name: Sue M
Title: Well worth a stroll
Review: Beautiful gardens.  Some time out for relaxation and a wander around in relative tranquillity.  We visited on a Sunday.  It was good to see the locals enjoying their down time.

Name: Prabhjot Singh Bhatti
Title: A Place for Fitness and sharing loneliness
Review: Lodhi Garden's was known as Lady Willington Garden in the era of Britishers. This Garden also has part of Botanical garden, wide range of different plants. In the morning and evening time fitness cautious people are running on track. There are Shish Gumbad- having number of grave in it, it has double story but history on it is not available. A very interesting is "Aadhpula" it has seven pier bridge constructed on "Nlah"(Drain) Lodhi Garden is very near to Safdarjung Air port, Basically it has Graves of Mughal Emperors. It is now being taken Care by the Archaeological Survey of India. Garden is very Beautifully maintained and people from different directions join here for picnic/photography etc.

Name: Jasmine C

Name: Annie

Name: Vishy
Title: Beautiful park

Name: doris
Title: Beautifull garden

Name: Parwani K
Title: Lodhi Garden

Name: Rohit Gera

It is also a bird sanctuary. It has a 2.5 km jogging track. It is neat and very well maintained. Toilets are very very clean.Parking is limited. If you are an American or European you must visit this park for the love of greenary. Take some pictures. Would not have seen so many flower types. There is also a Rose Garden inside. Must visit if you are in Delhi. Avoid sundays if feel claustrophobic in crowd. Enjoy nature.

Name: SanjeevMal
Title: A beautiful monument cum park in the heart of Delhi
Review: Lodhi Garden attracts walkers, joggers, photographers, tourists, picnickers and people wanting to spend time close to nature. It has some monuments, including a mosque and tombs from the Ibrahim Lodhi era. One can see the beautiful blue tiles in some places in the Sheesha Gumbad and the Bara Gumbad the later also has some beautiful calligraphy on its walls and ceilings. The trees and flowers are well maintained and walking paths are well laid out. Lodhi garden is especially good in the winters and autumn season.Parking is a problem and on a non-working day, one can park in the lanes near the Lodhi Garden. The nearest metro station would be Jor Bagh and Khan Market. Cycles for hire are available at the Jor Bagh metro station.

Name: Aashraya K
Title: Well maintained
Review: Lodhi garden is one of the most popular gardens in South Delhi. It has been extremely well maintained and come evening or early morning is often filled with people on their morning walks or exercising

Name: Alwaystravellinng
Title: Worth an evening stroll
Review: Well kept lovely gardens in city. Space air and lovely monuments with stunning lake views. Lots of swans on the water. Easy access not to much hassle as many families relaxing in great conditions.Need a good hour to walk through take photos etc.

Name: myriadresources
Title: The lung oh south Delhi
Review: Mind blowing gardens, non manicured and real! Good to cool your mind off the chaos of life- anytime. My personal favourite is mid day. N then if you’re a member at IIC, hop by for a cup of tea there overlooking the Lodi gardens yet again. An everyday visit for every age!

Name: Pittsburgh_cyclist
Title: More a park than a garden
Review: This is a lovely green space in the middle of New Delhi with birds and trees, but it is really a city park where people go to hang out. Having said that, I enjoyed my visit especially as the Mughal buildings were beautiful.
